comments:
I had 3.0M4 (SDK) installed, I manually installed the AspectJ plugin, then I
upgraded to 3.0M5 and that's when it first appeared. Somewhere in-between, I
switched from using the Sun 1.4.1 runtime to the 1.4.2. I also occasionally saw
workspace metadata loading problems at start-up.
After that, I tried completely re-installing the SDK (kept the workspace and
metadata) without AspectJ but the problem continued.
Then I tried the same, but also deleted the workspace metadata, but it persists.
This is at the start of the .log file (FYI):

!SESSION Δεκ 09, 2003 18:25:30.696 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.2
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=el_GR
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data C:\Dev\workspace
-install file:C:/Dev/eclipse/

I suspect that this plug-in has not been migrated to the RCP changes for M5.

I don't think this is related to the RCP changes.

Stefan, could you please check out the relevant M4 code, see how this might 
have occurred, and whether we still might have the same problem?

Judging from the stack trace, this seems to be a duplicate.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 47503 ***
